intro: [WRONG START] Codia bullata var. globosa, commonly known as the globe tree or globe hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its spherical, woody fruit that resembles a small globe, hence its common name. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with red stamens, which bloom in clusters during the rainy season. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often growing as a shrub or small tree. The fruit is edible and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
